name: misemphasis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
particular importance or attention that is wrongly given to something, or given in a way that is not correct: The authors claim that those favouring this hypothesis are guilty of misinterpretation, misattribution, and misemphasis. He found the text generally weak, with many errors, omissions, and mis-emphases. Related word
emphasis
extra force that is given to a particular word or to a particular part of a word in a way that is not correct: The text was read aloud by a computer, with significant misemphases and mispronunciations. He stressed this with comic mis-emphasis. Related word
emphasis
More examplesFewer examplesThis may have led to misemphasis in the treatment of his doctrines. He suggests that this mis-emphasis may have been because the history of this period was written from the perspective of the rulers.
